title.narrative: Efficient Public Assets Management and Civic Oversight
Efficient Public Assets Management and Civic Oversight

description.narrative:
Transparency International Ukraine (TIU) har lämnat in en ansökan till Sveriges ambassad i Kiev gällande ett projekt om 13,5 miljoner kronor som syftar till att stödja utvecklingen av det statligt ägda upphandlingssystemet "Prozorro.Sale". Prozorro.Sale är en öppen plattform där statliga organisationer bl.a. kan sälja, hyra ut, leasa och ge koncessioner vad gäller statliga tillgångar. Systemet har hittills visat sig att vara effektivt och har bidragit till minskad korruption. Det svenska stödet ska vara katalytiskt och bidra till utvecklingen av nya funktioner i systemet, samt en migrering till serverar i linje med ukrainsk lagstiftning. Utöver detta kommer TIU att ytterligare utveckla systemet för monitorering av både privata och statliga användare i syfte att göra systemet mer robust och motverka korruption.
Insatsens mål är att minska korruptionen inom förvaltningen av statliga tillgångar i Ukraina.
Målet kommer att uppnås genom a) utvecklingen av ett IT system för redovisning av nationella och kommunala tillgångar b) ett stärkt civilsamhälle som kan fungera som tillsynsorgan för privatiseringar, leasing osv, bl.a. annat via Prozorro.Sale c) förbättrad lagstiftning som minimerar korruption och möjliggör alla parters lika deltagande.
Detta kommer att ske genom att:
1) Bidra till en mer transparent och öppen marknad med förbättrade processer för försäljning och leasing av nationella och kommunala tillgångar genom teknisk utveckling av den elektroniska plattformen Prozorro.Sale. 2) Möjliggöra offentlig tillgång till information om hantering av statliga tillgångar. 3) Etablera ett nätverk av civilsamhällesaktörer för övervakning av statliga tillgångar på kommunal nivå 4) Bedriva påverkansarbete för att förbättra lagar/regelverk för nyttandet av offentliga tillgångar och egendom.
Ambassaden bedömer också att insatsen kan komma att bidra till ökad ekonomisk aktivitet och utveckling, särskilt bland lokala småföretagare och dessutom bidra till kommunala skatteintäkter.

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

8.3 - Främja utvecklingsinriktad politik som stöder produktiv verksamhet, skapande av anständiga arbetstillfällen, företagande, kreativitet och innovation samt uppmuntra att mikroföretag liksom små och medelstora företag växer och blir en del av den formella ekonomin, bland annat genom tillgång till finansiella tjänster.

8.3 - Promote development-oriented policies that support productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity and innovation, and encourage the formalization and growth of micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises, including through access to financial services.

9.b - Stödja inhemsk teknikutveckling, forskning och innovation i utvecklingsländerna, inklusive genom att säkerställa en gynnsam policymiljö för exempelvis industriell diversifiering och förädling av råvaror.

9.b - Support domestic technology development, research and innovation in developing countries, including by ensuring a conducive policy environment for, inter alia, industrial diversification and value addition to commodities.

title.narrative: Decision on Contribution Efficient Public Assets Management and Civic Oversight
Grant Agreement Efficient Public Assets Management and Civic Oversight

description.narrative:
The project aims to increase the efficiency of property accounting and sales auctions and improve the quality of public policy in this area by providing and technically improving innovative electronic tools. The increasing transparency, accountability, and development of user-friendly IT tools help the government manage state assets properly, nurture investors' interest, while enhancing civic oversight.
It is envisaged to transfer all the results of the IT development project to the government of Ukraine. TI Ukraine started by preparing all necessary procedures for cooperating with key stakeholders to develop and eventually share the developed IT tools with the government.
At the beginning of the project implementation, TI Ukraine conducted meetings with project key stakeholders in the public property management field of Ukraine. As a result, TI Ukraine signed three memoranda of cooperation on achieving the project goals with the State-owned enterprise PROZORRO (link), the Ministry of Economy of Ukraine (link), and the State Property Fund of Ukraine (SPFU) (link).
TI Ukraine pushed for "Efficient Public Assets Management and Civic Oversight" (Sida Contribution No13736) registration project with the International Technical Assistance database of Ukraine, administered by the Secretary of the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine. The registration card of the International Technical Assistance may be accessed here.
Simultaneously, TI Ukraine established a team of highly specialized team members, consisting of TI Ukraine specialists who realize critical activity and the Prozorro.Sale IT team, which helps to maintain the electronic trade system Prozorro.Sale.
TI Ukraine in cooperation with IT specialists of Prozorro.Sale IT team, prepared the number of terms of references for IT development under the project.
Also, in cooperation with the SPFU, TI Ukraine prepared the technical requirements (Mission, Vision, Business Requirements Document) to develop an IT platform for publishing and visualization of the property and assets roster - a new and innovative State Property Register. In 2021 the Cabinet of Ministrers adopted the Degree "On action plan for the implementation of the Open Government Partnership Initiative, 20212022" (link), including the commitments to "ensuring transparency in public asset accounting" according to the recommendations of TI Ukraine, the result of which will feed the information and telecommunication system software.
During the first year of the project implementation, TI Ukraine followed the processes of big and small privatization of Ukraine. The State Property Fund of Ukraine announced two competitions for selling big-scale privatization objects. The first one - ex-plant "Bilshovyk" (the first Kyiv Machine-Building Plant) was sold on 27 October 2021. The starting price of the object was UAH 1.389 bln. Ltd. General Commerce a domestic Ukrainian investor, has acquired the asset for UAH 1,429,017,000. This became the first large-scale privatization auction in Ukraine in 15 years. Another object, "United Mining and Chemical Company," was in the pipeline. However, the State Property Fund cancelled the auction for the third time due to the insufficient number of applications.
At the end of 2021 the head of the SPFU was changed, but TI Ukraine continued to coordinate with top-management of the SPFU.
The small-scale privatization and lease procedures are going on e-auctions via the electronic trade system Prozorro.Sale.
In December 2021, Prozorro.Sale received the Open Government Award, which is the most prestigious award in the field of open governance. The system competed in the category OGP Impact Awards as the one changing the country, improving the quality of life in society, and making the authorities' actions open to citizens.
There were 4300 small-scale privatization auctions with incomes of 4,6 billion UAH and 25,4 thousand lease auctions with payments of more than UAH 104 million in 2021. The total amount of public property realizations after Prozorro.Sale to the state and local budget is more than UAH 25,4bn. TI Ukraine monitored the most relevant auctions on the national level and published the materials on public property sales and lease processes.
TI Ukraine selected local partners for proper civic monitoring on the regional level and established the Dozorro.Sale community. Some 5 NGOs became members of a "watchdog" community, which oversees the municipal property management and makes an effort to increase the level of efficiency of this area through cooperation with local city councils.
During the reporting period, TI Ukraine systematically monitored legislative initiatives in the field. The project team analyzed 35 drafts of laws and published five positions and legal analyses of legislative initiatives in the state assets management area. We established partnerships with eight governmental and non-governmental organizations and held 14 advocacy meetings with stakeholders.
TI Ukraine established an expert group to develop drafts of legislation and local council decisions on the better policy for property management. An expert group consists of key stakeholders members like the SPFU, the Ministry of Economy of Ukraine, and the Reform Support Team of the Ministry, SE Prozorro.Sale, the Reform Delivery Office of the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine, and Members of the Parliament of Ukraine.
Advocacy Work for Enabling Legal Framework
TI Ukraine prepared advocacy plans for improving legislation on municipal property management on the national level. This work plan consists of advocacy and communication activities.(link)
During the reporting period TI Ukraine analized 35 legislative initiatives. (link)
TI Ukraine established partnerships with 8 governmental and non-governmental organizations, and held 14 advocacy meetings with stakeholders. The aim was to expand the list of partners and contacts among expert profile organizations in order to develop and promote changes to the current legislation of Ukraine in the field of public property management.
During the reporting period TI Ukraine systematically monitored and analyzed legislative initiatives for corruption and economic risks. The result of this activity is the development of statements, recommendations and proposals for improving draft laws, which were addressed to the MPs.
In October 2021 an expert group in Ukraine for the development of draft laws and local council decisions in the field of public property management was established. The group worked on legislative propositions and consisted of representatives of TI Ukraine experts, SE Prozorro.Sale, the State property Fund of Ukraine, the Ministry of economy of Ukraine and other national executive bodies. The recommendations were taken into account by the Committee on Economic Development of Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine.
On January 2021, the MPs registered the privatization package drafts of laws:
No 4572 On Amendments to the Law of Ukraine On State Property Fund of Ukraine and Other Legislative Acts of Ukraine No 4573 On Amendments to the Code of Administrative Offenses of Ukraine and the Criminal Procedural Code of Ukraine No 4574 On Amendments to the Tax Code of Ukraine (Regarding the Sale of State and Municipal Property Objects) No 4575 On Amendments to the Budget Code of Ukraine
They concern changes in the work of the State Property Fund, writing-off the accumulated tax debt of state and municipal enterprises, distribution of proceeds to the state and local budgets from privatization, and establishment of administrative liability in the field of property management.
During 2021 the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine was considering 4 draft laws from the privatization package at various stages.
In November 2021 TI Ukraine published:
The recommendations for draft law No4572 On Amendments to the Law of Ukraine On State Property Fund of Ukraine and Other Legislative Acts of Ukraine Regarding the Assistance in Attracting Investment in the Process of Privatization and Lease of State and Municipal Property was prepared and submitted to the Committee on Economic Development of Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine. TI Ukraine prepared the legal analysis with recommendations for the draft law No4572. The recommendations for draft law No4573 On Amendments to the Code of Administrative Offenses of Ukraine and the Criminal Procedural Code of Ukraine Regarding the Improvement of the State Policy for Managing Objects of State and Municipal Property was prepared and submitted to the Committee on Economic Development of Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine. TI Ukraine prepared the legal analysis with recommendations for the draft lawNo4573. The recommendations for draft law No4574 On Amendments to the Tax Code of Ukraine (Regarding the Sale of State and Municipal Property Objects) was prepared and submitted to the Committee on Economic Development of Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine. TI Ukraine prepared the legal analysis with recommendations for the draft law No4574. The recommendations for draft law No4575 On Amendments to the Budget Code of Ukraine Regarding Funds from the Privatization of State-Owned Objects was prepared and submitted to the Committee on Economic Development of Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine. TI Ukraine prepared the legal analysis with recommendations for the draft law No4575.
The number recommendations were taken into account, but the bills are very voluminous and amend up to 26 legislation acts. That was one of the reasons for the long deliberations in the Parliament and the delay in decision-making. Another reason is the numerous controversial changes. Prior to the war, the Verkhovna Rada did not have time to consider and approve.
Also, TI Ukraine published complex material, which describes the main issues of this privatization package.
After the full-scale invasion of Ukraine in February 2022, TI Ukraine in cooperation with the State Property Fund of Ukraine had work meetings on developing the propositions on improving the privatization legislation and sending them to MPs. The part of changes from draft law No4572 including TI Ukraine recommendations will be taken into account in the future draft law.
Advocacy of the reform of transparent standard for state / communal property accounting.
On 31 January, 2022 TI Ukraine conducted the strategic session of the expert group on the reform of state property accounting Roadmap for Public Property Accounting Reform.
The participants discussed a draft of the Roadmap for Public Property Accounting Reform. The developed Roadmap for Public Property Accounting Reform include the next necessary steps:
Development and implementation of a public, open and easy-to-use web portal (IT platform), which will allow everyone to get the full range of information about state-owned objects: inclusion in the database of technical passports and geolocations of state property. integration of the web portal with the Register of buildings (which lists all buildings located in Ukraine). Development and implementation of draft amendments to the legal framework, in order to regulate the functioning of the new State Property Unified Register as a public, open and convenient IT platform by: amendments to some laws of Ukraine on the functioning of the State Property Unified Register and Information Interaction. amendments to the bylaws on the regulations of the State Property Unified Register. Providing opportunities for monetization of the new State Property Unified Register in order to further technical support of the new IT platform: defining a list of paid services for users; revenue from the paid functionality of the system will be used to service the new system. development of changes to the regulatory framework governing the operation of the Register, registration and appropriate changes at the legislative level. Establishing administrative liability for incomplete and untimely submission of information on state-owned objects: amendments to the Code of Administrative Offenses by adding the article "Violation of the procedure for submitting information for the state property registration".
After processing the results of strategic session TI Ukraine developed 2 draft laws, which comprise suggestions by the participants:
On Amendments to some laws of Ukraine on the functioning of the State Property Unified Register and Information Interaction. On Amendments to the Code of Ukraine about administrative offenses concerning establishment of responsibility for violation of the order of the account of objects of state property.
These draft laws amend the legislative acts of Ukraine and greatly simplify access to data on state-owned property in Ukraine. The first one provides a legal framework for the new register operation, establishes the SPFU by the registers holder and sets the fee for providing an extract from the register. The second draft law helps to add an article to the Code of Ukraine about administrative offenses establishing liability for violations of the procedure of maintaining the new register.
Advocacy of the modernization of legal regulation for lease of state and municipal property.
Advocacy of the regulations for sale of property of debtors in bankruptcy cases to be conducted via electronic auctions.
In May 2021 recommendations for draft law No4409 On Amendments to the Bankruptcy Code of Ukraine were prepared and submitted to the working group of the project team and the Ministry of Justice of Ukraine.
Advocacy of the adoption of the necessary legislation and its improvement.
In September 2021 recommendations for draft law No5397 On Amendments to the Law of Ukraine On Privatization of State and Municipal Property to clarify certain provisions and promote investment during the privatization process was prepared and submitted to the working group of SE Prozorro.Sale and the State property Fund of Ukraine. The recommendations were taken into account by the Committee on Economic Development of Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine.
On 9 November, 2022 TI Ukraine conducted the work discussion Complaints and Appeals Commission: How to Organize Effective Work?
According to the results of expert discussion TI Ukraine prepared 1 draft of Degree Procedure for consideration of complaints and proposals regarding the preparation and holding of electronic auctions for the sale of small-scale privatization objects and the alienation of state-owned objects.
The procedure allows entrepreneurs to appeal for violations of their rights in privatization auctions in a short period of time without need to complain to the court. The document will also regulate the powers of the Complaints Commission and its members. The draft of the Degree will be sent to the Ministry of Economy of Ukraine for the following consideration and registration.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
